title: Archiv Agency premium travel website frontend routing, branding, imagery, and required features

requirements.summary: Ensure Home is the default route and all required top-nav routes render successfully without missing/blank states.
acceptanceCriteria: Launching the app opens the Home page (route '/') successfully.
Clicking each navbar item navigates to its corresponding page and renders content without errors.
There is no route in the navbar that leads to a missing component, empty page, or console error.

file_operations.description: Verify all required routes are registered (/, /about, /tour-guide, /services, /tour-packages, /vehicles, /honeymoon-offers, /booking) and ensure the default index route renders Home reliably with the current TanStack Router setup.
Ensure routed content area always renders (no blank states) and that layout wrappers do not block route rendering on initial load.

requirements.summary: Implement the exact navbar menu labels and order consistently on desktop and mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar displays exactly the 8 specified items in the specified order on desktop.
Mobile menu displays the same 8 items in the same order.
All 8 items link to the correct routes.

file_operations.description: Confirm navLinks contains exactly: Home, About, Tour Guide, Services, Tour Packages, Vehicles, Honeymoon Offers, Booking in that order, and that both desktop and mobile menus render from the same source list.

requirements.summary: Update brand copy usage on the frontend: show the required Home hero CTA text and ensure brand name displays as Archiv Agency.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo getSiteInfo().tagline returns exactly "Your Trusted Partner for Unforgettable Travel Experiences".
Home hero prominently displays "Explore the World With Archiv Agency".
User-facing brand name appears as "Archiv Agency" in the navbar/branding.

file_operations.description: Update the hero primary call-to-action messaging to prominently display the exact text "Explore the World With Archiv Agency" (separate from button labels if needed) while continuing to render the siteInfo tagline and name.
Ensure the visible brand label in the navbar/branding reads exactly "Archiv Agency" (and remains consistent with siteInfo.name usage elsewhere).
Align footer brand/supporting copy to use the siteInfo tagline string (or match the required tagline verbatim) so user-facing messaging is consistent across the site.

requirements.summary: Use unique, high-quality travel imagery across every page/section and across all card/grid items without repeating images.
acceptanceCriteria: No two sections/cards across the entire site reuse the same image URL/file.
Home includes distinct images for the hero, featured destinations, and offers banner areas.
Tour Guide profiles each have distinct photos.
Tour Packages cards each have distinct images.
Vehicles cards each have distinct images.
Honeymoon page uses distinct romantic-destination imagery that is not reused elsewhere.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust Home sections to ensure distinct imagery per section, including adding a featured-destinations card grid and an offers banner with its own unique image; ensure none of the Home images are reused by other pages/cards.
Add distinct guide profile photos (unique URLs per guide card) and ensure the guide page hero/section imagery does not repeat images used elsewhere.
Add unique vehicle images (one per vehicle card) using stock-style URLs and ensure no vehicle image is reused on other pages.
Ensure Services page includes its own distinct hero/section imagery (stock-style URL or existing generated image not used elsewhere) and avoid reusing imagery across other pages.
Verify every honeymoon offer card image is unique and not reused on Tour Packages/Home; replace any repeated/shared assets with distinct stock-style URLs if needed.
Ensure each tour package card image is unique and not reused across Home or Honeymoon; replace any collisions with distinct stock-style URLs if needed.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent premium/luxury visual system across all pages with cohesive spacing, card styles, and subtle animations; keep all sections non-empty.
acceptanceCriteria: All 8 pages have complete, non-placeholder content and cohesive layout.
Buttons/cards/sections have consistent spacing and visual hierarchy across pages.
Animations are subtle (e.g., hover elevation, fade/slide-in) and do not break layout on mobile.

file_operations.description: Refine global typography/spacing defaults for a premium feel (e.g., consistent section padding, improved headings, smooth hover/transition primitives) without introducing new global stylesheet files.
Ensure Tailwind theme tokens (fonts/animations) support a cohesive luxury system used across pages (e.g., subtle transitions, consistent container sizing).
Audit and polish About page section density and card/spacing patterns so it matches the premium layout system and remains non-empty.

Audit and polish Services page layout (grid/card spacing, hover states, section structure) to match the premium system; ensure all sections render real content (no placeholders). Use shadcn-ui Card/Button/etc. to standardize presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Polish Booking page layout hierarchy (form, contact panel, imagery sizing) and align interactions with the premium system; ensure no layout issues on mobile. Use shadcn-ui form primitives already in use. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Make the theme color preset drive the full brand system site-wide and remove page-specific hardcoded color palettes.
acceptanceCriteria: Switching theme presets changes the visual color of primary buttons, badges, icon accents, link hover states, and highlighted headings across every page.
No page uses a standalone color system that ignores the selected theme preset (e.g., no isolated page-only palette that remains unchanged).
Theme color selection persists across reload (localStorage behavior remains functional).

file_operations.description: Remove/replace the page-specific "romantic" color tokens/classes so Honeymoon uses the shared theme system (primary/accent tokens) for badges, icons, backgrounds, borders, and buttons.
Apply theme-driven accent styling for active/hover nav items (e.g., hover/active using primary) so navbar branding and interactions visibly respond to the selected ThemeColorProvider preset.
Ensure footer links/icons use theme-driven hover/active colors (primary) and do not introduce any hardcoded page-specific colors.
Verify theme preset application covers core brand tokens used by buttons/links/badges/icons/headings site-wide and that localStorage persistence remains functional.

Ensure the global CSS variable tokens used by Tailwind (primary/accent/ring/etc.) are applied consistently, and remove any unused/special-case palette variables that cause pages to diverge from the selected theme preset.

requirements.summary: Home page: add required premium sections—hero (tagline + required CTA), featured destinations, and an offers banner—each with unique imagery.
acceptanceCriteria: Home includes a featured destinations section with multiple cards and unique images.
Home includes a distinct offers banner section with its own unique image.
Hero contains the required tagline and the CTA text is clearly visible.

file_operations.description: Implement featured destinations card grid (multiple cards) with unique images and premium card styling, and add a dedicated offers banner section with unique imagery and promotional copy. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a responsive testimonials slider/carousel and surface it on the Home page with smooth transitions.
acceptanceCriteria: A testimonials slider is visible and rotates between at least 3 testimonials.
User can navigate testimonials (e.g., next/prev or dots) on desktop and mobile.
Slider does not cause layout shift or overflow on small screens.

file_operations.description: Create a responsive testimonials slider component with smooth transitions, multiple testimonials, and user navigation controls. Use shadcn-ui Button/Card where appropriate for controls and layout consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render the TestimonialsSlider on the Home page (at minimum), ensuring it fits the premium layout system and remains responsive without overflow. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Booking page: keep the simple form, add a WhatsApp contact button with a prefilled message including the selected package, and show a clear confirmation after submission.
acceptanceCriteria: Booking page contains a WhatsApp button that opens a wa.me (or WhatsApp) link in a new tab.
The WhatsApp prefilled message includes the package name when the booking page is opened with a package selected.
Submitting the booking form shows a confirmation message and does not throw errors.

file_operations.description: Update WhatsApp link generation to include a URL-encoded prefilled message that references the selected package (from query params when present), and ensure it opens in a new tab; keep existing confirmation UI after form submission. Use shadcn-ui Button for a clear WhatsApp CTA. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a contact section with a contact form and a responsive embedded Google Map (iframe) and ensure it is reachable from the site.
acceptanceCriteria: A contact form is present with basic fields and a submit interaction (client-side).
A Google Map embed is displayed via iframe and is responsive (no horizontal overflow).
Contact section is accessible via scrolling/navigation without broken anchors.

file_operations.description: Extend the existing Home contact section to include a responsive Google Map iframe embed alongside/below the contact form; ensure the section remains reachable via an in-page CTA and does not overflow on mobile. Use shadcn-ui Card/layout primitives for consistent presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a footer 'Contact' internal link/CTA that navigates users to the Home contact section (without breaking SPA routing) so the contact area is reliably reachable from anywhere.

requirements.summary: Implement smooth scrolling for in-page CTAs and ensure mobile responsiveness across all pages (navbar, grids, cards, forms).
acceptanceCriteria: In-page CTA links that scroll to sections do so smoothly.
All pages render correctly on mobile widths without overlapping elements or clipped content.
Mobile menu opens/closes reliably and routes correctly.

file_operations.description: Enable smooth scrolling behavior globally (e.g., scroll-behavior) and add any safe responsive base tweaks to prevent horizontal overflow across sections.

Verify the mobile Sheet menu opens/closes reliably, routes correctly, and does not overflow; ensure tap targets and spacing are mobile-friendly. Use existing shadcn-ui Sheet/Button components as currently composed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure in-page CTAs that scroll to the contact section do so smoothly and remain functional on mobile; audit responsive grid behavior for all Home sections.

requirements.summary: Improve SEO/performance hygiene: update HTML title and essential meta tags; ensure images use reasonable sizing/loading attributes.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html title references "Archiv Agency" (not the template title).
Meta description is present and relevant to Archiv Agency travel services.
Pages avoid obviously oversized images for small containers and do not spam the console with errors/warnings.

file_operations.description: Set the document title to reference "Archiv Agency" and add essential meta tags (description, og:title, og:description) appropriate for a premium travel agency site.

Audit key above-the-fold images for performance hygiene by adding appropriate loading/decoding attributes where applicable and ensuring images are not rendered at obviously excessive sizes for their containers.
Audit package grid images to ensure consistent container sizing and add appropriate loading attributes to reduce layout shift and keep pages fast.

requirements.summary: Add a professional footer with social media links/icons that open externally and do not break navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer displays a social links area with at least 3 social icons/links.
Social links open externally (new tab) and do not break SPA routing.
All internal footer links that are shown navigate to valid routes.

file_operations.description: Add a social links section (e.g., Instagram/Facebook/YouTube/LinkedIn placeholders) using external anchors that open in a new tab with proper rel attributes; verify existing internal links only point to valid routes.
